text: Giovanni Battista Brevi (Bergamo, ca. 1650; Milan, after 1725) was an Italian Baroque composer. His later collections of cantatas comprised three out of the four publications of Fortuniano Rosati, Modena, the fourth being by count Pirro Albergati.Michael Talbot Aspects of the Secular Cantata in Late Baroque Italy 2009 Page 94 ==Works== *Op. 3 Bizzarrie armoniche, ovvero Sonate da camera a tre stromenti col basso continuo 1693Andreas Giger, Thomas J.
